title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonics
b. No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for superclass), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeName
f. The label could say 'Select destination type:'.
g. Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
c. Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
e. The destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
OB: The browse button is too small. The title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog. The destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
EB: I would use the title for 'Move static field(s)' and use the description for 'x fields from xx'. The selection dialog should be initialized with the type currently entered.
SR:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member. 
2. Observe the browse button size.
3. Observe the text in the title field when it contains long text.
4. Go to the next page and observe the message 'Type not found'.
5. Verify that only types from the source folders of the own project are shown in the dialog.
6. Try selecting the destination type as the source type and verify that the refactoring process does not warn about errors and does not make any changes in referencing classes.
